body: I agree a timestamp column (maybe in human-readable or as you say from the first byte) would be very useful in `mitmweb`.

issue.title: Mitmweb: Make columns configurable/customizable

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.body:
#### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
E.g. if I have a lot of clients connected, I want to see the source IP directly in one column.

#### Describe the solution you'd like
* I want to right-click on the column header, and have a list of checkboxes there, so I can select one to show it.
* Additionally, I want to be able to switch the order of the columns via drag & drop and resize each column, so I can adjust it so I like it.
* That may be saved in local storage (maybe?), so I can have a per-device profile.

#### Describe alternatives you've considered
Always show the source IP as a column?
But this is annoying if you only have one device.

_And_ by making it customizable we could satisfy many more use cases.

#### Additional context
Again see how browser devtools do it.

body:
Feel free to send a PR and you'll have it in the official binaries. PRs are welcome! :) 

Regarding our binaries, see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/62334867/how-are-the-pre-compiled-mitmproxy-binaries-actually-built.

As for "keep scrolling to bottom" AFAIK `console_focus_follow` should do it. The doc is sparse, but you can enable it in the web interface and it worked in my test.
Enabling that from the command line, did not â€“ for whatever reason: https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/issues/4108

issue.body:
#### Description

issue #4092 

mitmweb has no functionality to show timestamp and sort by timestamp.
I added the functionality.

body:
adding 'Timestamp' to web_collums gives me the timestamp of the `First request byte`
however I cant sort the collum

@mhils it seems you implemented the timestamp column with 65aa0a6ef5 just the formatting isn't to nice, sorting works, didn't check for "follow"-mode though. Can you confirm?
I added the "timestamp" column to the default list and fixed the css-class so it's correctly aligned but aside from that I see no reason why this issue could not be closed. I'd feel bad pushing that b/c you did all the work.
@HoffmannP: What kind of formatting would you prefer?
I was unspecific, I meant right alignment, also you used the class col"-start" in tsx and "col-timestamp" in less for the `width:auto`
Good catch, thanks! I've fixed up the timestamp column, if you see further improvements please don't hesistate and open a PR! ðŸ˜ƒ

I just now see your edit in https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/issues/4092#issuecomment-945587627 - no worries on that, no hard feelings at all. I'm very happy if someone has some love for the web interface. If you have any dev questions, please don't hesistate to reach out here or on Slack. ðŸ˜ƒ
